fact_check_explanation_title: Viral video makes incorrect claims about teenagers and vaccine consent
fact_check_explanation_summary: A 2020 court case, known as Bell vs Tavistock, doesn’t mean it’s illegal to vaccinate teenagers without parental consent or a court order

fact_check_explanation_title: What we know about the Taliban and Covid-19
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims the Taliban took over Afghanistan with no vaccines, masks or mass deaths amongst their population. This seems unlikely from what we know about the country at …

fact_check_explanation_title: WD-40 did not say it “makes screwing a pleasure”
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a fake ad created as a joke. It gets the name of its own product wrong, for starters.

fact_check_explanation_title: 9/11 video doesn’t prove plane didn’t hit South Tower
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post shows the moment Flight 175 struck the South Tower of the World Trade Center.

fact_check_explanation_title: HGV securing point rules aren’t changing
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post cites the defunct government agency VOSA.

fact_check_explanation_title: What the National Insurance rise means for the tax burden
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s been claimed the NI rise will take the tax burden to the highest level “in history”, in peacetime, since 1948, since 1950 and since 1969.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Free Morrisons food box’ offer is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook claims that people can receive a free food box in exchange for comments and shares.

fact_check_explanation_title: Scottish Water says there’s no radium in its drinking water
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral Facebook post claims a Scottish Water worker was overheard saying radium in the water is making people sick.

fact_check_explanation_title: A survey of diversity in children’s books is flawed
fact_check_explanation_summary: A BBC News article said 10% of children’s books have an ethnic minority character, but this figure comes from flawed research.

fact_check_explanation_title: Data doesn’t show parents will ‘insist’ on children wearing masks to school
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Mail Online article incorrectly claims ‘23% of parents of secondary pupils will insist their children wear masks’.

fact_check_explanation_title: Germany has not stopped using Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post falsely claims Germany’s government no longer recommends Covid-19 vaccination.

fact_check_explanation_title: How soon after childbirth can you have a Covid-19 vaccine?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Guidance says you can have a Covid-19 vaccine anytime during pregnancy or after birth.
